title: Business Development Consultant

description:
Job Summary
• The BDC is responsible for generating new business with light industrial companies as well as professional offices.
• This position requires outdoor in person cold calls as well as phone calls. Must interact with potential clients and customers who need staffing support, listen to their needs, establish a close relationship and find employees to help them achieve their business goals. They must take client orders and work with the recruiting teams to ensure the order life cycle, resolves problems, and develops business through customer service.
• This position will report to VIP Staffing Regional Sales Manager.

Requirements
• 2 to 5 years of staffing industry experience
• Recruiting or sales experience.
• Strong written & oral communications with presentation skills
• Skills in business development, sales, and marketing
• Ability to manage multiple clients
• Strong computer skills .
• Ability to maintain a good working relationship with a diverse workforce and broad client base

Responsibilities Include (but Not Limited To)
• Conduct market research to identify new business prospects and generate sales leads.
• Develop & create prospect lists and execute a sales strategy generate new business. This includes cold calls & follow-up calls, presentations, conducting contract negotiations, and closing the sale.
• Foster relationships by attending & participating in local networking groups such as the local Chamber of Commerce and other business groups as determined in an agreed-upon sales strategy.
• Solicit new clients by making telephone sales calls to schedule & conduct field visits with business owners, key managers, senior level executives, and other decision makers.
• Document any potential safety issues with the client’s site of operation and confirm job descriptions are accurate.
• Address and resolve any customer service issues quickly and efficiently to maintain the highest level of customer satisfaction. Home office in the South Dallas area must start and end the day in the office.
